content: pattern by alyssa latuchie picacho peak | a lightweight all over lace hat | yarn the plucky knitter primo fingering 385yds/100g or your favorite fingering weight yarn 205yds/188m used in sample materials us 3 3 25mm 16 /40 cm circular needles us 4 3 5mm 16 /40cm circular needles - or size necessary to achieve picacho peak is a great hike to do before sunrise if you can gauge make it to the peak for sunrise you are really in for a well us 4 3 5mm dpns deserved treat it allows you to get away from it all while 8 removable marker one staying close to town this hat has a beautiful and bold lace which is different from the pattern the lace looks complex but is just a combination of others to mark the basic increases and decreases and with every other row beginning of the round being all knit you get to stay close to the basics while the tapestry needle results are anything but basic gauge and size 24 sts x 36 row = 4 /10cm in stockinette st on larger needles blocked 20 / 51cm circ blocked picacho peak �1 pattern by alyssa latuchie directions abbreviations cast on cdd - centered double decrease slip 1 st as if to purl using the smaller needles cast on 128 sts using the long tail with yarn in back knit the next co method place a marker to mark the beginning of the two stitches together and pass the slipped stitch over 2 sts round and join for knitting in the round being careful not to decreased twist co - cast on brim k - knit round 1 *k1tbl p1* to end k2tog - knit 2 sts together 1 st decreased repeat round 1 approximately 20 more times resulting in a brim measuring 2 5 /6 5cm then switch to larger needles p - purl body round s - round s ssk - slip slip knit 1 st round 1 and all subsequent odd rnds knit from chart repeat decreased chart 8 times it is helpful to place stitch markers between chart repeats at this time st s - stitch es yo - yarn over 1 st increased round 2 and all subsequent even rnds until round 50 k all sts round 50 and all subsequent even rnds knit from chart repeat chart 8 times switch to dpns when needed after round 59 cut the yarn leaving a long tail thread it onto a tapestry needle and pull it through the remaining sts finishing weave in ends wash and block gently picacho peak �2 pattern by alyssa latuchie picacho peak �3
